annotation.TEXT: Somehow, I just barely cleared those spikes, but all that's up here are a few coins. I see stuff above, but I have no idea how to get up there.
Zwee! Okay, now let's Start+Select out, and have BJ1 reenter the level at its midpoint entrance...

Now, I went through this level again off camera later, but I couldn't find a fifth ! coin, so I was once again shortchanged. Also, most of those turn blocks I rushed past in the second half had nothing in them, although one of them had another flower.
No Yoshis because they all lost their shirt at the casino.
So, the coins here say "BB". What does that mean, exactly? Maybe to press B twice here? Or, do they represent Bowser and BJ? (UPDATE: They likely refer to BBKaizo.)
What, a "nothing" block? I hate those cheapskate blocks that can't even be bothered to give a simple one coin...
Ah, but that block's no cheapskate! It contains a flower! ...Unfortunately, BJ2 is full up on flowers right now... Too bad it's not BJ1's turn, as he's the one that can use them.
BARF! ...Well, now BJ2 can use another flower...

Alright, it's boss time, against Joe himself! He looks like Morton, acts like Morton, and even smells like Morton, but don't be fooled! (However, you can easily beat him the same way as Morton, so even if you are fooled, it won't matter.)
That was interesting... Now, I remember that the middle block here has a flower, so let me quickly grab that (not that it's important or anything).
Oh, geez. I've dillydallied too much again... Alright, I'm going to just quickly hit that block with this shell and then book it!
But, man... Getting around that pipe above the Thwomp will be tough.
Ha! I got lucky that Mr. Wizard decided to spawn right under my drilling feet there!
However, that block is only instantly fatal to a BJ in his "small" state. A powered-up BJ (that isn't dumb enough to press down right away here) won't die instantly.
Anything in that pipe up there? Looks like it'll be tricky to check...

Whoops, didn't mean to open up the life-sharing thing. That tends to be annoying when you're trying to replay a castle in a 2-player game, but just continue holding L and R as you put the life-sharing window away, and you'll enter the castle without fail.
There's ! coin number 3...
There's so many turn blocks that I'm curious to check, but I'm in a hurry here!
Okay, there's the second ! coin, and a Chuck that just doesn't want to die from me hitting a nearby block...

And, that's that! BTW, I checked those two ? blocks to the right of the boss door when I rechecked this level for ! coins off camera, and they both contain just coins. That's all. Unfortunately, I didn't find any more ! coins, so I've been shortchanged yet again.
This level's certainly rich in flowers that BJ2 doesn't need. Man, it's really too bad that it's not BJ1's turn...
What the heck? Something weird happened to BJ's graphics there while he was jump kicking the castle.
Oh, what?! I could've gone through the middles of these pipes all this time?! Argh, yeah, I totally didn't think of that, and unnecessarily made things difficult for myself...
Well, I'm pretty sure I don't want to use the A button on those blocks down there! (Though, maybe they're unbreakable, but why even test that theory?)

Well, at least the shell eventually hit the block that time. And yeah, it contains nothing, like many of the other blocks in this level, so it should be removed or at least changed into a block that spins when hit.
That block up there looks mighty tricky to hit...
I doubt I can go through any of these blocks. Does this place at least have a side exit?
Goal tape average so far: 300 / 10 = 30 stars each.
So, yeah. See all those double pipes above me at the start here? I didn't think that they might've been "hollow" at first, so let's check them out again...
Yep, totally "hollow". And this is how I'm supposed to reach the stuff up above that I saw the first time.
Good thing there were coins guiding me for that otherwise blind jump. Ooh, an ! coin. All together now: "Will there be at least 5 ! coins in this level?"
Okay, that Lava Lotus died when I broke a block that was close to it, so what was the deal with that earlier Clapping Chuck?
Well, I hope you all enjoyed watching me play this 2-world demo of Bowser Jr.'s Adventure! See y'all later! (And if I missed anything important, let me know!)
I'd rather have another power up instead of a 1-up, but whatever.
Oh, come on. This block shouldn't be that hard to hit.
Oh, come on! I did not see that spike coming! (Although, if that spike wasn't there, I probably would've fallen right into the abyss.)
Umm... Those two coins I'm leaving behind there are way too tricky to reach without falling in the pit. BBKaizo, you should probably move them one space higher.
Whoa! Wasn't expecting a sudden rebound like that, which fortunately went right over my head.
Man, you'd think that one of the pipes up here would be enterable or something...
Aww, looks like it's the end of the 2-world demo, dudes, but is that level enterable?
Seriously, what the heck? I have no idea why that Chuck didn't get KO-ed by me breaking that block when he was right next to it.
There's the fourth ! coin... Oh, man... Time is really low now!
So, did the tip of BJ's head just not rotate along with the rest of him? BBKaizo, you might want to fix this, since it doesn't look right for BJ's head to be detaching like that.
Ow, my iBran! (It's Apple's new cereal product, which you're supposed to have with Apple Jacks or Apple Cinnamon Cheerios.)
And it was just a regular spinning turn block...
Good thing there are plenty of duders that I can use to get through the walls instead of having to wait for the wizard's magic.

...Yeah, the midpoint entrance starts the player right on top of that solid block. Seriously, BBKaizo, that block definitely has to be removed, or at least changed into a turn block that spins if it's hit (which won't be deadly to start off on top of).
Whew, made it to the goal in time. I only got 30 stars from the goal tape, but that's fitting, as my average was already exactly 30 at that moment, and still is.
There's an ! coin, but the age-old question must once again be asked: Does this level contain at least 5 of them?
Okay, this looks mighty tricky... I think I've gotta spin jump off of this Thwomp to get up there.
Aw, man! That shell was unable to kill either of the Thw*mps there? Also, that hit was semi-intentional, since there's the replacement mushroom right there.
Wow, that's a lot of pipes. Umm... I don't think I'll be checking every pipe this time... I'll check some of them, though.
I'm going to assume not, and I think I'm not going to bother checking any other tricky-to-reach pipes in the sky from now on. (If there is anything in any of those pipes, let me know!)
Ow, my iBarn! (It's a new Apple product that has farming-related apps.)
Anything hidden up here? ...What about above this block to the left?
Oh, hey! I finally killed a Thwimp and a Thwomp! 'Bout darn time!
Is there even anything of value in that block? Probably not, but I'll check it anyway.
And of course, BJ1's only gonna get mushrooms in this level, isn't he? Man, BJ2's been having all the luck with the flowers lately.
Man, I'm only just now reaching midpoint? I've really gotta hurry then. Also, I'm not going to bother with checking most blocks anymore.
Well, at least I can clobber Lil' Sparky without worrying about sprite slots.
GAAAMMMEEE!!!
Oh, hey there, wizard. Nice to see you wizardrying it up.
Alright, there's one last thing for me to show, and it involves more "hollow" pipes in Joe's Pipe Castle. BJ1 can have the last hurrah with this.
So, yeah. I got up there, but I didn't want to lose my reserve mushroom. However, I probably should've just let the reserve mushroom go in this case...
Come on, BJ. This isn't VVVVVV, where you can afford to recklessly crash into spikes like that. Also, of course, the shell's not in a proper sprite slot to kill the Thwomp.
Demo count: 1
(UPDATE: Zeldara109 pointed out to me that that was actually a Roy look-alike, not Morton. My mind just assumed it was Morton without taking a close look. Oops.)
Still can't seem to find any enterable pipes. Man, it would be sad if this pipe castle didn't have a single enterable pipe in it...
Aw, nuts. No replacement mushroom there, after all the trouble I went through to get up here?
Ooh, lucky. The Thwimp was killable with that shell. Now, it looks like all that's up here of value is a 1-up and four coins. Come on, not even an ! coin? This would've been a good place to put one.
Yeah, again, I figured it was a good idea to ditch the shell.
I could've certainly gotten those two coins, but I'm not going to worry about them. I don't want to waste too much time again.
First, let me race to midpoint. Shouldn't take too long if I'm not dillydallying. (But, maybe I should've sped this part up anyway. Well, whatever.)
Maybe I should've asked the wizard to work his magic on the timer before I shelled him... (Nah, his magic never affects the clock.)
There's a mushroom just rolling around down here for whatever reason. (Too bad it doesn't have a "rolling" animation. That'd be neat. ("Do a barrel roll!"))
Huh, that block setup looks almost similar to the familiar SMB 1-1 setup. Also, that wizard's back again.
Oh, what was the deal there? I thought my fireballs were hitting that guy while he was on the slope at first, but it turns out my fireballs were actually being stopped by the slope itself.
Ow, my iNarb! (Okay, I have no idea what that product is even supposed to do.)
Alright, so it's BJ2's turn right now...
Nuts, no more fun adventure, guys...
Nothing, although I see another ! coin way up there, but how do I reach it? ...Probably from the right.
Nuts, I didn't hit enough non-Chuck enemies to get any 1-ups from that star-kill combo...
D'oh, I was gonna use that shell...
Hello, and welcome to quite possibly the finale of Bowser Jr.'s Adventure! Let's start making our Way to Joe now...
Yep.
Yes. Alright, now I'm going to return to Way to Joe to point out that level-design flaw I discovered earlier.
Whoa, that was close.
But, there's just a bunch of colorful blocks and a message box.
Oh, that Clappin' Chuck died to me hitting the nearby turn block that time.
I also discovered a major level-design flaw in Way to Joe while rechecking it off camera, which I will point out later. But for right now, let's check out Joe's Pipe Castle with BJ1!
Ow, my misleading sprite size!
Argh, again I'm unable to kill a Thwimp... Come on, the sprite slots have to line up properly for Thw*mp-killing eventually.
Okay, the hardest-to-hit block contained a flower at least. I currently have no use for it, but it's nice to know it's there.
Yeah, if I'd only considered the possibility of these pipes being of the "hollow" variety sooner...

So, I guess I'm done with this hack now. It had some decent level designs, but many levels need more ! coins, and Fire Flowers were kinda rare. Also, BJ's small and super sprites should be made to be different from each other, and Way to Joe's midpoint issue definitely needs fixing. Oh, and did the Green Switch Palace even affect anything? I don't recall ever seeing any green ! blocks.
Now, I'm going to replay that jump-kicking animation at half speed and then at quarter speed, so we can get a better look at BJ's graphical oddity there.
Yeah, I should ditch that shell here. I wouldn't want it to screw up the Parakoopa hops here.
I did find one other place where I could go through hollow pipes, though, and I'll show that off later, but for right now, let's kick this castle's butt!
I'll definitely take this star!
Do these blocks contain anything? They'd better not all be "nothing"s.
Yep, it was Joe alright, not Morton (or Roy). Anyway, what's with the weird spacing of the words here?
